elements.label: Potential Acquaintances
elements.description: Particularly useful individuals frequent this place.

elements.label: Potential Patrons
elements.description: Particularly influential individuals frequent this place.

elements.label: Whereabouts
elements.description: Details concerning the comings and goings of a notable individual. [If you failed to entice someone into your service, you can use this card to find them again.]

elements.label: Trapped
elements.description: A very nasty surprise will befall the Hunter who decides to investigate this.

elements.label: Believer
elements.description: A fledgling devotee to the mysteries.

elements.label: Scholarly
elements.description: Someone who enjoys an abundance of time and literature. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Rational Observations, which can be used to address certain research challenges.]

elements.label: Impassioned
elements.description: Someone possessed of an overdeveloped sense of imagination. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Eccentric Notions, which can be used to address certain research challenges.]

elements.label: Loyal
elements.description: One never knows how loyalty is born. [This follower cannot rebel against you.]

elements.label: Famous
elements.description: Someone blessed and cursed with renown. [Using this follower anywhere has a chance to produce Reputation cards. However, painting a portrait of this follower can produce unique rewards, and they excel at Cult Business.]

elements.label: Jealous
elements.description: An unhealthy fixation; an acrid obsession; an easily-wounded heart. [When romancing another, this follower may gain Resentment.]

elements.label: Pacifist
elements.description: This one will follow, but only so far. [Harming, terrorizing, or killing innocents and adversaries will cause this follower to gain Resentment.]

elements.label: Frail
elements.description: We all must die, but this one is more inclined to end than most. [This follower will die at two scars rather than three.]

elements.label: Bully
elements.description: There is a dark joy to be found in gloating. [When you promote this follower, they will inflict Resentment on another random follower.]

elements.label: Enterprising
elements.description: It is one thing to seek opportunity; it is another to make it. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Funds.]

elements.label: Thorough
elements.description: Someone who knows how to cover their tracks. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Secrecy.]

elements.label: Amicable
elements.description: Someone considered good company. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Contentment.]

elements.label: Sentimental
elements.description: Conversations with this one tend to be memorable in some fashion. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce a Fleeting Reminiscence.]

elements.label: Rambling
elements.description: Oftentimes they speak nonsense, but sometimes they speak of something else. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Fascination.]

elements.label: Morbid
elements.description: Their words have a tendency to stick, and then to rot. [Whenever this follower is used, there is a small chance they will produce Dread.]

elements.label: Defiant
elements.description: One never knows how loyalty is ended. [This follower can rebel at two Resentment.]

elements.label: Prepared
elements.description: An experienced traveler; a seasoned provisioner; a reliable pair of hands. [This follower will automatically add one Fund to any expedition they are sent on.]

elements.label: Resilient
elements.description: Some can live through more pain than seems reasonable. [This follower will die at four scars rather than three.]

elements.label: Scar: Swollen Stitches
elements.description: There is only so much difference between man and meat.

elements.label: Loyalty to the Moth
elements.description:
'In vain, in vain - the all-composing hour
Resistless falls: the Muse obeys the power.
She comes! she comes! the sable throne behold
Of Night primeval, and of Chaos old!'

- Alexander Pope

elements.label: Loyalty to the Malachite
elements.description:
'What gentle ghost, besprent with April dew,
Hails me so solemnly to yonder yew,
And beckoning woos me, from the fatal tree
To pluck a garland for herself or me?'

- Ben Jonson

elements.label: Loyalty to the Vagabond
elements.description:
'Much have I traveled in the realms of gold
And many goodly states and kingdoms seen;
Round many western islands have I been
Which bards in fealty to Apollo hold.'

- John Keats

elements.label: Loyalty to the Watchman
elements.description:
'The man who listens to Reason is lost; Reason enslaves all whose minds are not strong enough to master her.'

- George Bernard Shaw

elements.label: Loyalty to the Madrugad
elements.description:
'In the dawn, armed with a burning patience, we shall enter the splendid Cities.'

- Arthur Rimbaud

elements.label: Loyalty to the Forge of Days
elements.description:
'And the smith his iron measures hammered to the anvil’s chime; Thanking God, whose boundless wisdom makes the flowers of poesy bloom; In the forge’s dust and cinders, in the tissues of the loom.'

- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

elements.label: Loyalty to the Colonel
elements.description:
'One man scorned and covered with scars still strove with his last ounce of courage to reach the unreachable stars; and the world will be better for this.'

- Miguel de Cervantes

elements.label: Loyalty to the Lionsmith
elements.description:
'I am going to be a storm - a flame - I need to fight whole armies alone; I have ten hearts; I have a hundred arms; I feel too strong to war with mortals - BRING ME GIANTS!'

- Edmond Rostand

elements.label: Loyalty to the Wolf-Divided
elements.description:
'Have I not the reason to hate and to despise myself? Indeed I do; and chiefly for not having hated and despised the world enough.'

- William Hazlitt

elements.label: Loyalty to the Sun-in-Rags
elements.description:
'The splendid silence clings
Around me: and around
The saddest of all kings
Crowned, and again discrowned.'

- Lionel Johnson

elements.label: Loyalty to the Elegiast
elements.description:
'Some hang above the tombs,
Some weep in empty rooms,
I, when the iris blooms,/nRemember.'

- Mary Coleridge

elements.label: Loyalty to Snow
Loyalty to the Thunderskin
elements.description:
'On with the dance! Let joy be unconfined;
No sleep till morn, when Youth and Pleasure meet
To chase the glowing Hours with flying feet.'

- Lord Byron

elements.label: Loyalty to the Velvet
elements.description:
'For secrets are edged tools,
And must be kept from children and from fools.'

- John Dryden

elements.label: Loyalty to the Sister-and-Witch
elements.description:
'The weird sisters, hand in hand,
Posters of the sea and land,
Thus do go about, about.'

- William Shakespeare

elements.label: Loyalty to the Red Grail
elements.description:
'It is only by enlarging the scope of one’s tastes and one’s fantasies, by sacrificing everything to pleasure, that the unfortunate individual called Man, thrown despite himself into this sad world, can succeed in gathering a few roses among life’s thorns.'

- Marquis de Sade

elements.label: Loyalty to the Flowermaker
elements.description:
'And whosoever of them ate of the honey-sweet fruit of the lotus, had no longer any wish to bring back word or to return, but there they were fain to abide among the Lotus-eaters, feeding on the lotus, and forgetful of their homeward way.'

- Homer

elements.label: Loyalty to the Beachcomber
elements.description:
'If men had wings and bore black feathers, few of them would be clever enough to be crows.'

- Henry Ward Beecher

elements.label: Loyalty to the Mother of Ants
elements.description:
'Yet some there be that by due steps aspire
To lay their just hands on that golden key
That opes the palace of Eternity.'

- John Milton

elements.label: Loyalty to the Meniscate
elements.description:
'Slowly, silently, now the moon
Walks the night in her silver shoon;
This way, and that, she peers, and sees
Silver fruit upon silver trees.'

- Walter de la Mare

elements.label: Loyalty to the Horned Axe
elements.description:
'On that day I will punish all who leap over the threshold, who fill the house of their master with violence and deceit.'

- Zephaniah 1:9

elements.label: Loyalty to the Mare-in-the-Tree
Tenacious
elements.description: This Hunter will outmanoeuvre or endure perhaps one physical assault in three, even when the attack would otherwise be unstoppable.

elements.label: Mystic
elements.description: This Hunter will usually withstand or outwit attacks by creatures of the Mansus, even if those attacks would otherwise be unstoppable. They are also more likely to retaliate when you send summonings to track them down.

elements.label: Published
elements.description: Even if I destroyed every print copy of my adversary's work, the public consciousness will ensure the information lives for much longer. [Published Evidence cannot be destroyed.]

elements.label: Observant
elements.description: This Hunter can sometimes turn Mystique they pick up into Notoriety.

elements.label: Corrupt
elements.description: This Hunter can sometimes be bribed to overlook criminal evidence... but their price may become steep.

elements.label: Belligerent
elements.description: This Hunter may sometimes use Notoriety to plan and order physical attacks on you and your followers. They are also more likely to retaliate when you send mortal followers to track them down.

elements.label: Clairvoyant
elements.description: While this Hunter is on the board, there is a chance that dreaming in the Mansus will produce Notoriety.

elements.label: Publicist
elements.description: Evidence produced by this Hunter will be made available to the public, and cannot be destroyed.

elements.label: Year-Hardened
elements.description: This Hunter must suffer four wounds to be defeated, rather than three.

elements.label: Mithridatic
elements.description: Poisons will not affect this Hunter.

elements.label: Persuasive
elements.description: This Hunter will not produce Evidence. Instead, they will attempt to sow Resentment amongst your followers using Notoriety and other Reputation cards.

elements.label: A Hunter's Wound
elements.description: This hunter has paid the price for their curiosity. [A hunter will perish after suffering three wounds, unless they posses unnatural fortitude.]

elements.label: In Hiding
elements.description: Recent calamity has driven this Hunter into hiding. [A Hunter possessing this aspect cannot be targeted by your attacks. Speaking to a Lantern or Knock follower about them may uncover their hiding place.]
